item.title: Effects of local drug crisis evident in Kamsack, Sask.
item.description:
Effects of local drug crisis evident in Kamsack, Sask.

If the first step to recovery is admitting there's a problem, three First Nations around Kamsack, in east-central Saskatchewan, have reached that point. â€‹Leaders of the Federation of Saskatchewan Indian Nations and the Key, Cote and Keeseekoose First Nations sounded the alarm this week about a crisis in their communities.

item.title: Why are so many prisoners from ethnic minorities? I intend to find out | David Lammy
item.description:
Why are so many prisoners from ethnic minorities? I intend to find out | David Lammy

Where America leads, Britain usually follows. Art and culture, film and fashion, language and political ideas all have a habit of crossing the Atlantic. But in one important area of British life we must resist this trend: the incarceration rates for ethnic minorities.

item.title: Do hangovers really get worse as you get older?
item.description:
Do hangovers really get worse as you get older?

You drink, you drink, you drink and then somehow, you get up, shake it off, and get on with your life. Remember when drinking was like that, when you were young and invincible and you hadn't really thought through the meaning of student debt? That was nice wasn't it?

item.title: A Drug Trafficking Gang That Posed as a Flower Business Just Got 125 Years in Prison | VICE | United Kingdom
item.description:
A Drug Trafficking Gang That Posed as a Flower Business Just Got 125 Years in Prison | VICE | United Kingdom

The gang, from Holland and the northwest of the UK, were importing guns, weed, coke, MDMA and heroin.

item.title: Five giant missiles have been delivered to Downing Street
item.description:
Five giant missiles have been delivered to Downing Street

Protesting the sale of deadly British arms to the Yemen The stunt, organised by Amnesty International, saw dummy missiles paraded around Parliament to protest British arms sales to Yemen.

item.title: Psychedelics can't be tested using conventional clinical trials - Nicolas Langlitz - Aeon Opinions
item.description:
Psychedelics can't be tested using conventional clinical trials - Nicolas Langlitz - Aeon Opinions

Psychedelic research is back from underground laboratories to university hospitals. When LSD, mescaline and psilocybin were prohibited in 1970, all academic research on humans was abandoned for two decades. Now the return of psychedelic drugs to highly regarded research facilities, which began in the 1990s, is on the verge of reaching its goal.

item.title: The Secret Life of a Silk Road 2.0 Mastermind
item.description:
The Secret Life of a Silk Road 2.0 Mastermind

On one side of the kitchen, he was cooking for friends. On the other, he was running a multi-million dollar drug market from a laptop. "Technically I was still at work while I was doing dinner," the man claiming to be Dread Pirate Roberts 2, the creator of the second Silk Road drug marketplace, recalled to me in a meeting.

item.title: Do Psychedelic Drug Laws Violate Human Rights?
item.description:
Do Psychedelic Drug Laws Violate Human Rights?

The prohibition of MDMA and hallucinogenic mushrooms restricts "cognitive liberty," according to some activists. Please consider disabling it for our site, or supporting our work in one of these ways Subscribe Now >
